body.post:
The Summathy Blog This is a blog about mathematics. The site is currently under construction. For the time being it serves as a place to keep a short mathematical diary, recording whatever I though about and/or learned during the week. However I hope to expand the scope of this blog with videos and notes in the future.
This website is built upon MathJax, XyJax and other javascript libraries. There may be problems with older browsers or those with javascript disabled.

Dayly Ramblings
25.Aug.25
There is a functor-homology description of $\Bbb{E}_n$-homology developed extensively by Fresse, Fresse-Ziegenhagen, Ziegenhagen and Livernet-Richter. It is based on a category $\mathsf{Epi}_n$, which should be related to the operator category of Batanin's pruned n-trees. Can we recover the (multi)complex defined by Livernet-Richter via the morphism of operator categories $\Bbb{O}^{\times n} \rightarrow \Bbb{O}^{\wr n}$?
